chapter.title: Adding an AIM account
chapter.para:
To add an AIM account, click "Add" on the "Accounts" window. The following appears:
Add Account Dialog

Since we're adding an AIM account, the Protocol field is already set to what we want. Here's a quick breakdown of what all the fields you see mean:
Username
Enter the screen name you want to log in with here
Password
Enter the password for the screen name here
Remember password
If you don't want to have to type your password every time you launch Pidgin, you can feel free to click this checkbox.
Local alias
This field allows you to specify a name for yourself that only you will see. You may wish to set this field to something like "Me" or your name, initials, etc.
New mail notifications
If you use AIM Mail, or otherwise have a mail account tied to your screen name in such a way that the AIM servers can check for new mail, checking this box will display a notification when new mail arrives
Use this buddy icon for this account
This checkbox, when enabled, allows you to use the icon selector below it to choose a buddy icon specific to this account or to use the "Remove" button to clear an account-specific buddy icon. We'll discuss buddy icons later.

Now that we've gone over the basics, let's see what a typical AIM account might look like:
